page.title: 03Predannack Downs
page.content: Some of Predannack is owned by the National Trust and Hayle Kimbro Pool and Ruan Pool are sites of Special Scientific Interest.Hayle Kimbro Pool is the largest of the serpentine pools and has a lot of marshland which has many plants,dragonflies and birds.We found a lot of the plant Ragged Robin. We saw the ruins of an old cottage called Hervan.There are some walls which are about one foot tall and it was very small.On Hervan lane there is a tumulus at the top which was opened by W.C.Borlase in 1871 and urns and bones were found. We found out that on Predannack Downs in 1755 Richard Chaffers discovered china clay.It made pottery as good as Wedgewood.It was sent by horse and cart to Hayle and then it went by ship to Liverpool.He did not make a lot of money from his discovery.
